info.title: The Selling Partner API for Amazon Warehousing and Distribution
info.description: The Selling Partner API for Amazon Warehousing and Distribution (AWD) provides programmatic access to information about AWD shipments and inventory.

parameters.description: ID for the shipment. A shipment contains the cases being inbounded.
parameters.name: shipmentId

parameters.description:
If equal to `SHOW`, the response includes the shipment SKU quantity details.

Defaults to `HIDE`, in which case the response does not contain SKU quantities
parameters.name: skuQuantities

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Show the additional SKU quantity details.
Hide the additional SKU quantity details.

x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit.description: Your rate limit (requests per second) for this operation.

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit.description: Your rate limit (requests per second) for this operation.

errors.details: This exception is thrown when client inputs are invalid
errors.message: ShipmentId should be present for this request

403.description: Indicates that access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The resource specified does not exist.

x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit.description: Your rate limit (requests per second) for this operation.

413.description: The request size exceeded the maximum accepted size.

415.description: The request payload is in an unsupported format.

429.description: The frequency of requests was greater than allowed.

500.description: An unexpected condition occurred that prevented the server from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

get.description:
Retrieves an AWD inbound shipment.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 2 | 2 |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation, when available. The table above indicates the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may see higher rate and burst values than those shown here. For more information, refer to [Usage Plans and Rate Limits in the Selling Partner API](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api)

parameters.description: Field to sort results by. By default, the response will be sorted by UPDATED_AT.
parameters.name: sortBy

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Sort by the time of update.
Sort by the time of creation.

parameters.description: Sort the response in ASCENDING or DESCENDING order. By default, the response will be sorted in DESCENDING order.
parameters.name: sortOrder

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Sorts the collection in ascending order.
Sorts the collection in descending order.
Shipment is created, but hasn't shipped.
Shipment was picked up by the carrier or was dropped off with the carrier.
The carrier has notified AWD that the shipment is in transit between the origin and destination nodes.
The shipment has been partially received.
The shipment has reached the destination node and has been delivered to the facility yard. The shipment `receive` process at the warehouse will start soon.
No more actions are required for the shipment. This is a final state.
The shipment is cancelled. This is a final state.

parameters.description: List the inbound shipments that were updated after a certain time (inclusive). The date must be in ISO 8601 format.
parameters.name: updatedAfter

parameters.description: List the inbound shipments that were updated before a certain time (inclusive). The date must be in ISO 8601 format.
parameters.name: updatedBefore

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description: A token that is used to retrieve the next page of results. The response includes `nextToken` when the number of results exceeds the specified `maxResults` value. To get the next page of results, call the operation with this token and include the same arguments as the call that produced the token. To get a complete list, call this operation until `nextToken` is null. Note that this operation can return empty pages.
parameters.name: nextToken

x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit.description: Your rate limit (requests per second) for this operation.

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit.description: Your rate limit (requests per second) for this operation.

get.description:
Retrieves a summary of all the inbound AWD shipments associated with a merchant, with the ability to apply optional filters.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 1 | 1 |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation, when available. The table above indicates the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may see higher rate and burst values than those shown here. For more information, refer to [Usage Plans and Rate Limits in the Selling Partner API](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api).

parameters.description: Filter by seller or merchant SKU for the item.
parameters.name: sku

parameters.description: Sort the response in `ASCENDING` or `DESCENDING` order.
parameters.name: sortOrder

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Sorts the collection in ascending order.
Sorts the collection in descending order.

parameters.description: Set to `SHOW` to return summaries with additional inventory details. Defaults to `HIDE,` which returns only inventory summary totals.
parameters.name: details

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Show the additional summarized inventory details.
Hide the additional summarized inventory details.

parameters.description: A token that is used to retrieve the next page of results. The response includes `nextToken` when the number of results exceeds the specified `maxResults` value. To get the next page of results, call the operation with this token and include the same arguments as the call that produced the token. To get a complete list, call this operation until `nextToken` is null. Note that this operation can return empty pages.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.
parameters.name: maxResults

errors.message: Invalid value: UNKNOWN passed for sort order. Possible values are: [ASCENDING, DESCENDING]

get.description:
Lists AWD inventory associated with a merchant with the ability to apply optional filters.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 2 | 2 |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation, when available. The table above indicates the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may see higher rate and burst values than those shown here. For more information, refer to [Usage Plans and Rate Limits in the Selling Partner API](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api).

Address.description: Shipping address that represents the origin or destination location.

addressLine1.description: First line of the address text.

addressLine2.description: Optional second line of the address text.

addressLine3.description: Optional third line of the address text.

city.description: Optional city where this address is located.

countryCode.description: Two-digit, ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 formatted country code where this address is located.

county.description: Optional county where this address is located.

district.description: Optional district where this address is located.

name.description: Name of the person, business, or institution at this address.

phoneNumber.description: Optional E.164-formatted phone number for an available contact at this address.

postalCode.description: Optional postal code where this address is located.

stateOrRegion.description: State or region where this address is located. Note that this is contextual to the specified country code.

CarrierCode.description: Identifies the carrier that will deliver the shipment.

CarrierCodeType.description: Denotes the type for the carrier.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Standard Carrier Alpha Code. Refer to [What is a Standard Carrier Alpha Code](https://www.help.cbp.gov/s/article/Article-1420?language=en_US) for more information.

DimensionUnitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for package dimensions.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Denotes package dimensions in inches.
Denotes package dimensions in centimeters.

contents.description: The contents appropriate for the type.

measurements.description: Measurements of a package, including weight, volume, and dimensions.

DistributionPackageContents.description: Represents the contents inside a package, which can be products or a nested package.

DistributionPackageQuantity.description: Represents a distribution package with its respective quantity.

count.description: Number of cases or pallets with the same package configuration.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Package type `CASE`.
Package type `PALLET`. Currently, the `PALLET` package type is not supported.

Error.description: Error response returned when the request is unsuccessful.

code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

ErrorList.description: This exception is thrown when client inputs are invalid.

errors.description: A list of errors describing the failures.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the shipment was created. The date is returned in ISO 8601 format.

externalReferenceId.description: Client-provided reference ID that can correlate this shipment to client resources. For example, to map this shipment to an internal bookkeeping order record.

orderId.description: The AWD inbound order ID that this inbound shipment belongs to.

receivedQuantity.description: Quantity received (at the receiving end) as part of this shipment.

shipBy.description: Timestamp when the shipment will be shipped.

shipmentContainerQuantities.description: Packages that are part of this shipment.

shipmentSkuQuantities.description: Quantity details at SKU level for the shipment. This attribute will only appear if the skuQuantities parameter in the request is set to SHOW.

destinationRegion.description: Assigned region where the order will be shipped. This can differ from what was passed as preference. AWD currently supports following region IDs: [us-west, us-east]

trackingId.description: Carrier-unique tracking ID for this shipment.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the shipment was updated. The date is returned in ISO 8601 format.

warehouseReferenceId.description: An AWD-provided reference ID that you can use to interact with the warehouse. For example, a carrier appointment booking.

InboundShipmentStatus.description: Possible shipment statuses used by shipments.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Shipment is created but has not yet shipped.
Shipment was picked up by the carrier or was dropped off with the carrier.
The carrier has notified AWD that the shipment is in transit between origin and destination node.
The shipment has been partially received.
The shipment has reached the destination node and has been delivered to the facility yard. The shipment receive process at the warehouse will start soon.
No more actions required on the shipment. This is a final state.
Shipment has been cancelled. This is a final state.

InboundShipmentSummary.description: Summary for an AWD inbound shipment containing the shipment ID, which can be used to retrieve the actual shipment.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the shipment was created.

externalReferenceId.description: Optional client-provided reference ID that can be used to correlate this shipment with client resources. For example, to map this shipment to an internal bookkeeping order record.

orderId.description: The AWD inbound order ID that this inbound shipment belongs to.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the shipment was updated.

ExpirationDetails.description: The expiration details of the inventory. This object will only appear if the details parameter in the request is set to `SHOW`.

expiration.description: The expiration date of the SKU.

onhandQuantity.description: The quantity that is present in AWD.

InventoryDetails.description: Additional inventory details. This object is only displayed if the details parameter in the request is set to `SHOW`.

availableDistributableQuantity.description: Quantity that is available for downstream channel replenishment.

replenishmentQuantity.description: Quantity that is in transit from AWD and has not yet been received at FBA.

reservedDistributableQuantity.description: Quantity that is reserved for a downstream channel replenishment order that is being prepared for shipment.

nextToken.description: Token to retrieve the next set of paginated results.

InventoryQuantity.description: Quantity of inventory with an associated measurement unit context.

unitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for the inventory.

expirationDetails.description: The expiration details of the inventory. This object will only appear if the `details` parameter in the request is set to `SHOW`.

totalInboundQuantity.description: Total quantity that is in-transit from the seller and has not yet been received at an AWD Distribution Center

totalOnhandQuantity.description: Total quantity that is present in AWD distribution centers.

InventoryUnitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for the inventory.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Measures a discrete amount of product units.
Measures a discrete amount of cases.
Measures a discrete amount of pallets.

LabelOwner.description: The entity that labels the products.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Amazon labels the products.
The seller labels the products.

dimensions.description: Dimensions of the package. Dimensions are required when creating an inbound or outbound order.

unitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for package dimensions.

PackageVolume.description: Represents the volume of the package with a unit of measurement.

unitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for the package volume.

PackageWeight.description: Represents the weight of the package with a unit of measurement.

unitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for the package weight.

PrepDetails.description:
The preparation details for a product. This contains the prep category, prep owner, and label owner.
Prep instructions are generated based on the specified category.

prepCategory.description: The preparation category for shipping an item to Amazon's fulfillment network.

prepInstructions.description: Information that pertains to the preparation of inbound products. This is generated based on the specified category.

PrepInstruction.description: Information pertaining to the preparation of inbound products.

prepType.description: The type of preparation to be done. For more information about preparing items, refer to [Prep guidance](https://sellercentral.amazon.com/help/hub/reference/external/GF4G7547KSLDX2KC) on Seller Central.

PrepOwner.description: The owner of the preparations, if special preparations are required.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Amazon owns the preparation.
The seller owns the preparation

ProductAttribute.description: Product instance attribute that is not described at the SKU level in the catalog.

ProductQuantity.description: Represents a product with the SKU details and the corresponding quantity.

attributes.description: Attributes for this instance of the product. For example, already-prepped, or other attributes that distinguish the product beyond the SKU.

expiration.description: The expiration date for the SKU. Values are in [ISO 8601](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/iso-8601) date-time format.

prepDetails.description:
Preparation details of a product which contains the prep category, prep owner and the label owner.
If not passed while creating an inbound order, NO_PREP will be used on the product by-default.
Prep instructions will be generated based on the category passed

ShipmentListing.description: A list of inbound shipment summaries filtered by the attributes specified in the request.

nextToken.description: A token that is used to retrieve the next page of results. The response includes `nextToken` when the number of results exceeds the specified `maxResults` value. To get the next page of results, call the operation with this token and include the same arguments as the call that produced the token. To get a complete list, call this operation until `nextToken` is null. Note that this operation can return empty pages.

SkuQuantity.description: Quantity details for a SKU as part of a shipment

VolumeUnitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for the package volume.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Denotes volume measurement in cubic inches.
Denotes volume measurement in cubic meters.
Denotes volume measurement in cubic centimeters.

WeightUnitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for the package weight.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Denotes weight measurement in pounds.
Denotes weight measurement in kilograms.
